src/dragon/events.js
EventEmitter
description:
Class for managing events.
Can be extended to provide event functionality in other classes.

unknown.tagValue: EventEmitter Manages event registering and emitting.

name: addListener
description:
Adds a listener function to the specified event.
The listener will not be added if it is a duplicate.
If the listener returns true then it will be removed after it is called.
If you pass a regular expression as the event name then the listener will be added to all events that match it.

params.name: evt
params.description: Name of the event to attach the listener to.

params.name: listener
params.description: Method to be called when the event is emitted. If the function returns true then it will be removed after calling.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: addListeners
description:
Adds listeners in bulk using the manipulateListeners method.
If you pass an object as the second argument you can add to multiple events at once. The object should contain key value pairs of events and listeners or listener arrays. You can also pass it an event name and an array of listeners to be added.
You can also pass it a regular expression to add the array of listeners to all events that match it.
Yeah, this function does quite a bit. That's probably a bad thing.

params.name: evt
params.description: An event name if you will pass an array of listeners next. An object if you wish to add to multiple events at once.

params.name: listeners
params.description: An optional array of listener functions to add.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: addOnceListener
description:
Semi-alias of addListener. It will add a listener that will be
automatically removed after its first execution.

params.name: evt
params.description: Name of the event to attach the listener to.

params.name: listener
params.description: Method to be called when the event is emitted. If the function returns true then it will be removed after calling.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: alias
description: Alias a method while keeping the context correct, to allow for overwriting of target method.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the target method.

name: defineEvent
description:
Defines an event name. This is required if you want to use a regex to add a listener to multiple events at once. If you don't do this then how do you expect it to know what event to add to? Should it just add to every possible match for a regex? No. That is scary and bad.
You need to tell it what event names should be matched by a regex.

params.name: evt
params.description: Name of the event to create.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: defineEvents
description: Uses defineEvent to define multiple events.

params.name: evts
params.description: An array of event names to define.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: emit
description:
Subtly different from emitEvent in that it will pass its arguments on to the listeners, as opposed to taking a single array of arguments to pass on.
As with emitEvent, you can pass a regex in place of the event name to emit to all events that match it.

params.name: evt
params.description: Name of the event to emit and execute listeners for.

params.name: Optional
params.description: additional arguments to be passed to each listener.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: emitEvent
description:
Emits an event of your choice.
When emitted, every listener attached to that event will be executed.
If you pass the optional argument array then those arguments will be passed to every listener upon execution.
Because it uses `apply`, your array of arguments will be passed as if you wrote them out separately.
So they will not arrive within the array on the other side, they will be separate.
You can also pass a regular expression to emit to all events that match it.

params.name: evt
params.description: Name of the event to emit and execute listeners for.

params.name: args
params.description: Optional array of arguments to be passed to each listener.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: flattenListeners
description: Takes a list of listener objects and flattens it into a list of listener functions.

params.name: listeners
params.description: Raw listener objects.

name: _getEvents
description: Fetches the events object and creates one if required.

name: getListeners
description:
Returns the listener array for the specified event.
Will initialise the event object and listener arrays if required.
Will return an object if you use a regex search. The object contains keys for each matched event. So /ba[rz]/ might return an object containing bar and baz. But only if you have either defined them with defineEvent or added some listeners to them.
Each property in the object response is an array of listener functions.

params.name: evt
params.description: Name of the event to return the listeners from.

return.description: All listener functions for the event.

name: getListenersAsObject
description: Fetches the requested listeners via getListeners but will always return the results inside an object. This is mainly for internal use but others may find it useful.

params.name: evt
params.description: Name of the event to return the listeners from.

return.description: All listener functions for an event in an object.

name: _getOnceReturnValue
description:
Fetches the current value to check against when executing listeners. If
the listeners return value matches this one then it should be removed
automatically. It will return true by default.

return.description: The current value to check for or the default, true.

name: indexOfListener
description: Finds the index of the listener for the event in its storage array.

params.name: listeners
params.description: Array of listeners to search through.

params.name: listener
params.description: Method to look for.

return.description: Index of the specified listener, -1 if not found

name: manipulateListeners
description:
Edits listeners in bulk. The addListeners and removeListeners methods both use this to do their job. You should really use those instead, this is a little lower level.
The first argument will determine if the listeners are removed (true) or added (false).
If you pass an object as the second argument you can add/remove from multiple events at once. The object should contain key value pairs of events and listeners or listener arrays.
You can also pass it an event name and an array of listeners to be added/removed.
You can also pass it a regular expression to manipulate the listeners of all events that match it.

params.name: remove
params.description: True if you want to remove listeners, false if you want to add.

params.name: evt
params.description: An event name if you will pass an array of listeners next. An object if you wish to add/remove from multiple events at once.

params.name: listeners
params.description: An optional array of listener functions to add/remove.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: removeEvent
description:
Removes all listeners from a specified event.
If you do not specify an event then all listeners will be removed.
That means every event will be emptied.
You can also pass a regex to remove all events that match it.

params.name: evt
params.description: Optional name of the event to remove all listeners for. Will remove from every event if not passed.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: removeListener
description:
Removes a listener function from the specified event.
When passed a regular expression as the event name, it will remove the listener from all events that match it.

params.name: evt
params.description: Name of the event to remove the listener from.

params.name: listener
params.description: Method to remove from the event.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: removeListeners
description:
Removes listeners in bulk using the manipulateListeners method.
If you pass an object as the second argument you can remove from multiple events at once. The object should contain key value pairs of events and listeners or listener arrays.
You can also pass it an event name and an array of listeners to be removed.
You can also pass it a regular expression to remove the listeners from all events that match it.

params.name: evt
params.description: An event name if you will pass an array of listeners next. An object if you wish to remove from multiple events at once.

params.name: listeners
params.description: An optional array of listener functions to remove.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: setOnceReturnValue
description:
Sets the current value to check against when executing listeners. If a
listeners return value matches the one set here then it will be removed
after execution. This value defaults to true.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to check for when executing listeners.

return.description: Current instance of EventEmitter for chaining.

name: src/dragon/mediator/index.js
content:
'use strict'

/**
 * Module Dependencies
 *
 * @ignore
 */
import EventEmitter from '../events'

/**
 * Mediator Class
 *
 * @public
 * @class Mediator
 */
class Mediator {

  /**
   * Mediator constructor
   *
   * @public
   * @constructor
   * @param {Object} options
   */
  constructor(options = {}) {
    // TODO: figure out how to mixin this
    var eventEmitter = new EventEmitter()

    this.emit  = eventEmitter.emitEvent.bind(eventEmitter)
    this.on    = eventEmitter.addListener.bind(eventEmitter)
    this.once  = eventEmitter.addOnceListener.bind(eventEmitter)
    this.off   = eventEmitter.removeListener.bind(eventEmitter)
  }

}

export default Mediator

attached
description: Whether the view attached to the DOM

name: attachOnInit
description: Whether to attach the view on initialization

name: attachPlacement
description: Determines where the view is attached into the container

name: bindDataOnInit
description: Whether to bind data from Incremental DOM to the view on initialization.

name: disposed
description: Whether the view has been disposed of.

name: renderOnInit
description: Whether to render the view's template(s) on initialization

name: _partials
description: Partial templates available to use in the reducer

name: _views
description: Sub views attached to the view
